meanings.definition: Theogony: the branch of theology that deals with the origin and genealogy of the gods.
meanings.sent1: In theogony, we study how the gods came to be.
meanings.sent2: The ancient text provided a detailed theogony of the gods.
meanings.sent3: The scholars' theogony discussion was both enlightening and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her theogony of the divine beings was as intricate as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: Learning about theogony makes the stories of gods more fascinating.

meanings.definition: Theogony: a narrative of the origin of the gods.
meanings.sent1: The theogony recounted the creation of the gods in a captivating way.
meanings.sent2: Many cultures have their own theogony explaining the gods' beginnings.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed the simplified theogony story during storytime.
meanings.sent4: His theogony of the gods was like a colorful painting coming to life.
meanings.sent5: The theogony tale was passed down through generations, preserving ancient beliefs.
